result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Richard Pruden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Richard Pruden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Richard Pruden was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Daniel Richard Pruden was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE called stating he pd SDC w/guaranteed funds & needs his jmts satisfied. DE was advised that we only rec'd a partial pymt from SDC for him this mo, but DE confirmed that he did pay the remaining $994.63 to SDC w/guaranteeds funds @ their EC location. DE was advised that we don't typically satisfy jmts til the money is rec'd from SDC, but that b/c we did receive confirmation of his pymt in full, we will satisfy his jmts, but one case will still show a remaining bal til SDC sends that pymt next mo. DE's agent may call to confirm. Includes 14CF103, 14CF507. jaf
Per verification from SDC that the DE PIF w/guaranteed funds. Bal will not show PIF til funds are rec'd from SDC in July, but jmt is satisfied. jaf

DE called stating he missed some pymts, but would like to get this pd off by Feb for credit reasons. DE was advised that he missed his Nov & Dec pymts & has already been turned over to SDC. - DE to have have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Carley and Carol Sarafin or their residence. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF:  Daniel Richard Pruden appeared. Case called at 8:16. 13CF205, 14CF103, 14CF507, 15CF288. ADA Hartung updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF507 and 14CF103. In 14CF507 Ct. 3, Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony. Court acknowledges the plea to Ct. 3. DE acknowledges the theft charges in 13CF205 and 15CF288 and accepts responsibility for the theft charges. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF507 and guilty of 14CF103. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses 13CF205 for purposes of restitution, Ct. 1 of 15CF288 for purposes of restitution and out right dismisses Ct. 2-6 in 15CF288 and Ct. 1 in 14CF507. Court orders a PSI completed within the next 60 days. Bond continues. Monies to be moved to the files for restitution and costs. On  13CF205- Restitution will be joint and several with C. Eggum 14CF302.   Address confirmed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Hartung. Requesting a plea date. km

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1400.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, WalMart in New Richmond.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  Daniel Richard Pruden appeared from jail.   Includes 14CF507 & (PayH) on 13FO75.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Waive speedy prelim.  Defendant to meet with payment clerk on 13FO75 -   QUASH WARRANT. Defendant's mother to pay $100.00 today for release (to apply to 13FO75).  Next payment due 1/21/15.  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
